summary: 50% of all Good Omens fanfiction is written by Michael Sheen. David Tennant writes 45% of it but has his wife post it because he...
body: 50% of all Good Omens fanfiction is written by Michael Sheen. David Tennant writes 45% of it but has his wife post it because he can’t figure out how, 3% is written by Neil Gaiman (who may or may not be possessed by the ghost of Terry Pratchett), and the remaining 2% is written by the fandom.

reblog.comment: 50% of all Good Omens fanfiction is written by Michael Sheen. David Tennant writes 45% of it but has his wife post it because he can’t figure out how, 3% is written by Neil Gaiman (who may or may not be possessed by the ghost of Terry Pratchett), and the remaining 2% is written by the fandom.

trail.content_raw: 50% of all Good Omens fanfiction is written by Michael Sheen. David Tennant writes 45% of it but has his wife post it because he can’t figure out how, 3% is written by Neil Gaiman (who may or may not be possessed by the ghost of Terry Pratchett), and the remaining 2% is written by the fandom.
trail.content: 50% of all Good Omens fanfiction is written by Michael Sheen. David Tennant writes 45% of it but has his wife post it because he can’t figure out how, 3% is written by Neil Gaiman (who may or may not be possessed by the ghost of Terry Pratchett), and the remaining 2% is written by the fandom.

tags: all white men look the same
or is it hugh tennant and michael blagden
no wait there's a third setting
the third setting is whatever makes certain pictures of matt smith remind me of eddie redmayne
and then whatever benedict cumberbatch is
i think he's one they dropped on the floor and picked up really quick
summary: Okay a few months ago I had this weird galaxy brain thing where I realized at certain angles David Tennant looks like a...
body: Okay a few months ago I had this weird galaxy brain thing where I realized at certain angles David Tennant looks like a scraggly, skinny, deranged Hugh Jackman, and now it’s happening again and I’m just gonna say it. Certain pictures of Michael Sheen from the late 1990s remind me of George Blagden.

reblog.comment: Okay a few months ago I had this weird galaxy brain thing where I realized at certain angles David Tennant looks like a scraggly, skinny, deranged Hugh Jackman, and now it’s happening again and I’m just gonna say it. Certain pictures of Michael Sheen from the late 1990s remind me of George Blagden.

trail.content_raw: Okay a few months ago I had this weird galaxy brain thing where I realized at certain angles David Tennant looks like a scraggly, skinny, deranged Hugh Jackman, and now it’s happening again and I’m just gonna say it. Certain pictures of Michael Sheen from the late 1990s remind me of George Blagden.
trail.content: Okay a few months ago I had this weird galaxy brain thing where I realized at certain angles David Tennant looks like a scraggly, skinny, deranged Hugh Jackman, and now it’s happening again and I’m just gonna say it. Certain pictures of Michael Sheen from the late 1990s remind me of George Blagden.

blog.name: uglywettiewrites
blog.title: Infinite Chaos, locked in 1.71 meters of flesh
blog.description:
Stoking the thirst since 2016. 
Proud tertiagenarian. Switch in every sense. 18+ only, please. I blog things that make me laugh. Or cry. Or thirst. I post in spurts, so check my archive if you want to stay abreast of my bursts of sparkling wit. I also write words about David Tennant's characters. Poetry. Original fiction. Mostly naughty. All nice.

answer: All day. E'ry day.

tags: harry potter and the goblet of fire
fic: the death eater & the auror
summary: The Death Eater & the Auror [AO3] {playlist} The hero’s story is always told with reverence, while the villain’s story is...
caption:
The Death Eater & the Auror [AO3] {playlist}

The hero’s story is always told with reverence, while the villain’s story is uttered with distaste and, sometimes, spitting upon saying their name. It is worth noting, however, that every villain is the hero in their own story –

- and, sometimes, a “villain” is really just a very unfortunate victim of very unfortunate circumstances.

Bartemius Crouch Jr. is one of such villains.

You know the story of the Boy Who Lived: he defeated Lord Voldemort when he was a baby, had a lightning scar, and saved the Wizarding World from tyrannical rule and complete and utter destruction. You know that his name is Harry Potter and that he is a hero.

But do you know the story of the Death Eater & the Auror? Do you know the story of two Slytherin boys who were best friends at Hogwarts, utterly inseparable for the better part of seven years? Do you know that they fell in love, during a time in which their love was still scorned and invalidated? Do you know that these best friends were ripped apart on a most unfortunate night, but that they found their way back to each other against all odds?

Do you know that, despite the appearance of guilt, the Death Eater & the Auror were innocents?

Of course you don’t. They were villains, after all.

A villain’s story, however, is still a story – and this one happens to be quite good.

This is the story of Barty Crouch Jr. & Edgar Finch.

Read the full fic on AO3

summary: Amazon Prime Releases Poster for Good Omens Armageddon is almost upon us...unless Aziraphale (Michael Sheen) and Crowley (David...
caption:
Amazon Prime Releases Poster for Good Omens

Armageddon is almost upon us…unless Aziraphale (Michael Sheen) and Crowley (David Tennant) can stop it, that is. Time to find the Anti-Christ.

Good Omens, based on the novel by Neil Gaiman and Terry Pratchett, hits Amazon Prime on May 31, 2019.
